oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Protocol compliance and training to prevent residues
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Lott, Kate
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: dairy
protocols
training
residue avoidance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Protocols and their compliance are imperative for the dairy industry for food safety, animal welfare and care, employee safety, antibiotic stewardship and for the financial success of the dairy. The veterinarian can help farmers have clear, simple protocols, help them to train people to the protocols, and help them to evaluate the success of the protocols with data and re­cords. With regular review and training, we can prevent resi­dues in food and have successful animal care and viable farms.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2022 Recent Graduate Conference Proceedings; 90-91
